Division.LongName: Div Of Chem, Bioeng, Env, & Transp Sys

Award.AbstractNarration:
This award supports the 44th Northeast Bioengineering Conference, a regional conference that provides an opportunity to undergraduate and graduate student researchers in the field of biomedical engineering to present their research to a broad audience. The conference has particular impact because it allows students who do not have the funding to attend a national scientific meeting to present their work to fellow students, regional faculty, and representatives from industry. The conference will be held on March 28-30, 2018, at Drexel University. The award primarily supports a reduction in student registration fees for all attendees, allowing the conference to be even more affordable. The ability to participate in conferences such as this encourages students to pursue graduate school and pursue an academic career.

The conference expects to attract about 400 attendees from around the Northeast region of the United States, with 60 - 75% expected to be students. Over 60% of the platform presentations will be given by trainees, in addition to 150 poster presentations. In addition to scientific presentations, sessions on career development in biomedical engineering will be included to specifically support professional development of the trainees. Key Note and Plenary speakers will be used to highlight cutting edge areas of research in both academia and industry. Themes of the presentations will include: Biomedical Engineering Entrepreneurship; Immunoengineering; Pediatric Bioengineering; Neuroengineering; and Mechanobiology.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The Northeast Bioengineering Conference (NEBEC) is the one of the two longest continually running conferences in the United States in the arena of biomedical engineering (BME).  Drexel University’s School of Biomedical Engineering, Science and Health Systems hosted the 44th NEBEC March 28-30, 2018.

NEBEC has historically been a student-centered conference. We continued that tradition by providing opportunities for undergraduate and graduate students to present their work. There was a total of 448 participants. 122 posters were shown in the undergraduate Design Poster session and 47 submissions were chosen for oral presentations.

 At NEBEC 2018, we held 4 state-of-the art faculty seminars in theme areas selected to reflect emerging or growing areas in bioengineering. Each session had four invited speakers selected based on their leadership and groundbreaking work in the areas of Neuroengineering, Mechanobiology, Pediatric Bioengineering and Immunoengineering.  In addition, there were three inspiring Keynote lectures by outstanding leaders in their fields.

Conference activities exposed students to leading edge research in biomedical engineering, to foster interest in pursuing careers in biomedical engineering research and innovation. A Keynote on Start-ups was followed by a Panel Discussion on Entrepreneurship in academia, industry and the c0linic. This session was followed by a networking event and provided networking opportunities for students with peers and with leaders in their fields. The conference also aimed to stimulate new collaborations among BME research groups in the Northeast.
